Only played the first 10 minutes but seems to work perfectly on a softmodded wii 4.2e using USBloader GX.

On a side note the English voice acting is cringe-worthy but you can change it to Japanese and get English Subs.

@rambo

thanks a lot for the advice! enjoy the game, you will love it

Fantastic! this game works without a problem on my Wii. The start screen is loaded and the music is playing and there are virtually no screen tears (those tiny black pixels).

I am running on a NTSC Wii that has system menu 4.1. uLoader is used to run it, and the game is on a USB drive that's been formatted to be WBFS. I didn't have to change the region settings (because uLoader does it automatically) and this is a great rip. Thank you Nextnomura! I'll be seeding.
i'm using this with a softmodded NTSC-U wii via configurable USB loader. it plays, but for some reason everything is in black and white. is anyone else experiencing this?

Chunk266, can you list all the details of your version of CFG usb loader? I'm using it and I'm getting the freeze during that cutscene.

@joemesh

I have mine working on CFG, see if this helps any:
Loader Version: 70
CFG base: sd:/usb-loader
FS: [ sd: ntfs: ]
IOS249 (r20)
Base: IOS57 rev20 mload v1.0
hi. i had the exact same issue with freezing. i solved it by using ntfs instead of fat32.

P.S. This doesn't work on NTSC lol, few of my friends tried.. it doesn't load. Either boots back to Wii menu or just black screens forever. You can't 'frii' this disc to NTSC lol. Games only 'Frii' to PAL, not the other way around.
Yes! Thank you siittari! That worked!

Any Wii console & game region combinations will work if you know what your doing. Sorry for being a bit late, was having too much fun with the game =p. I'm using a WBFS formatted usb, all my settings and stuff are exactly the same as when I first got them from mauifrog's guide on wiihacks.
